Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Muslims took out a rally demanding the release of the rape accused, when in fact, the original photograph and reports indicate that the rally was in support of the victim and against the accused.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Muslim groups in the region have strongly condemned the incident and demanded harsh penalty for the accused, including death penalty in some cases.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a photoshopped image and an article that has been proven to be false.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the Quran sanctions rape of non-Muslim women, without providing any evidence or credible sources to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that the rally was in support of the victim and against the accused, as reported by reliable sources.
